DOC.brief_summary: The present study will seek to quantify the muscle protein synthetic response to mycoprotein feeding, comparing it to milk protein as a gold standard and heavily researched positive control
DOC.brief_title: Does the Ingestion of Mycoprotein Elicit an Optimal Anabolic Response in Resting and Exercised Skeletal Muscle?
DOC.criteria: • BMI between 18 and 30 Any diagnosed metabolic impairment (e.g. type 1 or 2 Diabetes) Any diagnosed cardiovascular disease or hypertension. Elevated blood pressure at the time of screening (e.g. blood pressure of ≥140/90mmHg). Chronic use of any prescribed or over the counter pharmaceuticals. A personal or family history of epilepsy, seizures or schizophrenia. Anyone with previous motor disorders. An allergy to mycoprotein / Quorn, penicillin, or milk.
